{"step_by_step_thinking": "The floor of the mouth and suprahyoid muscles are supplied by the lingual artery. The lingual artery is a branch of the external carotid artery. It runs deep to the hyoglossus muscle and supplies blood to the tongue and floor of the mouth. The maxillary artery supplies blood to the deep structures of the face, while the inferior alveolar artery supplies blood to the mandible and teeth. The facial artery supplies blood to the superficial structures of the face.", "answer_choice": "A. Lingual artery"}
